intro: Aster distortus, commonly known as the bent-leaf aster, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its distinctive, often twisted leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Aster distortus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
